verses.kjv: Then came the children of Israel, even the whole congregation, into the desert of Zin in the first month: and the people abode in Kadesh; and Miriam died there, and was buried there.
verses.web: The children of Israel, even the whole congregation, came into the wilderness of Zin in the first month. The people stayed in Kadesh. Miriam died there, and was buried there.
verses.ct: The entire Israelite community arrived in the wilderness of Zin during the first month. The people settled in Kadesh, and it was there that Miriam died and was buried.

verses.kjv: And there was no water for the congregation: and they gathered themselves together against Moses and against Aaron.
verses.web: There was no water for the congregation; and they assembled themselves together against Moses and against Aaron.
verses.ct: There was no water for the community, so the people banded together against Moses and Aaron.

verses.kjv: And the people chode with Moses, and spake, saying, Would God that we had died when our brethren died before the LORD!
verses.web: The people quarreled with Moses, and spoke, saying, “We wish that we had died when our brothers died before LORD!
verses.ct: The people quarreled with Moses and said, "We wish we had died when our brothers died before the LORD!

verses.kjv: And why have ye brought up the congregation of the LORD into this wilderness, that we and our cattle should die there?
verses.web: Why have you brought LORD’s assembly into this wilderness, that we should die there, we and our animals?
verses.ct: Why did you bring the LORD's people into this wilderness to die — us and our animals?

verses.kjv: And wherefore have ye made us to come up out of Egypt, to bring us in unto this evil place? it is no place of seed, or of figs, or of vines, or of pomegranates; neither is there any water to drink.
verses.web: Why have you made us to come up out of Egypt, to bring us in to this evil place? It is no place of seed, or of figs, or of vines, or of pomegranates; neither is there any water to drink.”
verses.ct: Why did you drag us out of Egypt just to bring us to this terrible place? Nothing grows here — no grain, no figs, no grapes, no pomegranates — and there isn't even water to drink!"

verses.kjv: And Moses and Aaron went from the presence of the assembly unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, and they fell upon their faces: and the glory of the LORD appeared unto them.
verses.web: Moses and Aaron went from the presence of the assembly to the door of the Tent of Meeting, and fell on their faces. LORD’s glory appeared to them.
verses.ct: Moses and Aaron walked away from the crowd to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting and fell facedown on the ground. Then the glory of the LORD appeared to them.

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.web: LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD said to Moses,

verses.kjv: Take the rod, and gather thou the assembly together, thou, and Aaron thy brother, and speak ye unto the rock before their eyes; and it shall give forth his water, and thou shalt bring forth to them water out of the rock: so thou shalt give the congregation and their beasts drink.
verses.web: “Take the rod, and assemble the congregation, you, and Aaron your brother, and speak to the rock before their eyes, that it pour out its water. You shall bring water to them out of the rock; so you shall give the congregation and their livestock drink.”
verses.ct: "Take the staff, and gather the whole community together — you and your brother Aaron. Then speak to the rock right in front of them, and it will pour out water. You will bring water from the rock for the people, so that the community and their livestock can drink."

verses.kjv: And Moses took the rod from before the LORD, as he commanded him.
verses.web: Moses took the rod from before LORD, as he commanded him.
verses.ct: Moses took the staff from its place before the LORD, just as he had been commanded.

verses.kjv: And Moses and Aaron gathered the congregation together before the rock, and he said unto them, Hear now, ye rebels; must we fetch you water out of this rock?
verses.web: Moses and Aaron gathered the assembly together before the rock, and he said to them, “Hear now, you rebels! Shall we bring water out of this rock for you?”
verses.ct: Moses and Aaron assembled the whole community in front of the rock, and Moses shouted at them, "Listen up, you rebels! Do we have to bring water out of this rock for you?"

verses.kjv: And Moses lifted up his hand, and with his rod he smote the rock twice: and the water came out abundantly, and the congregation drank, and their beasts also.
verses.web: Moses lifted up his hand, and struck the rock with his rod twice, and water came out abundantly. The congregation and their livestock drank.
verses.ct: Then Moses raised his hand and struck the rock twice with his staff. Water gushed out in abundance, and the entire community and their livestock drank.

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses and Aaron, Because ye believed me not, to sanctify me in the eyes of the children of Israel, therefore ye shall not bring this congregation into the land which I have given them.
verses.web: LORD said to Moses and Aaron, “Because you didn’t believe in me, to sanctify me in the eyes of the children of Israel, therefore you shall not bring this assembly into the land which I have given them.”
verses.ct: But the LORD said to Moses and Aaron, "Because you did not trust me enough to honor me as holy before the Israelites, you will not be the ones to lead this community into the land I have given them."

verses.kjv: This is the water of Meribah; because the children of Israel strove with the LORD, and he was sanctified in them.
verses.web: These are the waters of Meribah; because the children of Israel strove with LORD, and he was sanctified in them.
verses.ct: This place became known as the waters of Meribah, because the Israelites quarreled with the LORD there, and through it he demonstrated his holiness among them.

verses.kjv: And Moses sent messengers from Kadesh unto the king of Edom, Thus saith thy brother Israel, Thou knowest all the travail that hath befallen us:
verses.web: Moses sent messengers from Kadesh to the king of Edom, saying: “Your brother Israel says: You know all the travail that has happened to us;
verses.ct: From Kadesh, Moses sent messengers to the king of Edom with this message: "Your brother Israel says: You know about all the hardships we've been through.

verses.kjv: How our fathers went down into Egypt, and we have dwelt in Egypt a long time; and the Egyptians vexed us, and our fathers:
verses.web: how our fathers went down into Egypt, and we lived in Egypt a long time. The Egyptians mistreated us and our fathers.
verses.ct: Our ancestors went down to Egypt, and we lived there for a long time. The Egyptians treated us and our ancestors cruelly.

verses.kjv: And when we cried unto the LORD, he heard our voice, and sent an angel, and hath brought us forth out of Egypt: and, behold, we are in Kadesh, a city in the uttermost of thy border:
verses.web: When we cried to LORD, he heard our voice, sent an angel, and brought us out of Egypt. Behold, we are in Kadesh, a city in the edge of your border.
verses.ct: When we cried out to the LORD, he heard us. He sent an angel and brought us out of Egypt. Now here we are in Kadesh, a town right on the edge of your territory.

verses.kjv: Let us pass, I pray thee, through thy country: we will not pass through the fields, or through the vineyards, neither will we drink of the water of the wells: we will go by the king’s high way, we will not turn to the right hand nor to the left, until we have passed thy borders.
verses.web: “Please let us pass through your land. We will not pass through field or through vineyard, neither will we drink from the water of the wells. We will go along the king’s highway. We will not turn away to the right hand nor to the left, until we have passed your border.”
verses.ct: Please let us pass through your land. We won't cut through any fields or vineyards, and we won't drink water from your wells. We'll stay on the king's highway and won't turn right or left until we've crossed your border."

verses.kjv: And Edom said unto him, Thou shalt not pass by me, lest I come out against thee with the sword.
verses.web: Edom said to him, “You shall not pass through me, lest I come out with the sword against you.”
verses.ct: But Edom replied, "You may not pass through here. If you try, I'll come out and meet you with an army."

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel said unto him, We will go by the high way: and if I and my cattle drink of thy water, then I will pay for it: I will only, without doing anything else, go through on my feet.
verses.web: The children of Israel said to him, “We will go up by the highway; and if we drink your water, I and my livestock, then I will give its price. Only let me, without doing anything else, pass through on my feet.”
verses.ct: The Israelites responded, "We'll stick to the main road. If we or our livestock drink any of your water, we'll pay for it. All we're asking is to walk through on foot — nothing more."

verses.kjv: And he said, Thou shalt not go through. And Edom came out against him with much people, and with a strong hand.
verses.web: He said, “You shall not pass through.” Edom came out against him with many people, and with a strong hand.
verses.ct: But Edom answered, "You will not pass through." Then Edom marched out against them with a large and powerful force.

verses.kjv: Thus Edom refused to give Israel passage through his border: wherefore Israel turned away from him.
verses.web: Thus Edom refused to give Israel passage through his border, so Israel turned away from him.
verses.ct: Since Edom refused to let Israel pass through their territory, Israel turned and went another way.

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel, even the whole congregation, journeyed from Kadesh, and came unto mount Hor.
verses.web: They traveled from Kadesh, and the children of Israel, even the whole congregation, came to Mount Hor.
verses.ct: The entire Israelite community left Kadesh and traveled to Mount Hor.

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses and Aaron in mount Hor, by the coast of the land of Edom, saying,
verses.web: LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron in Mount Hor, by the border of the land of Edom, saying,
verses.ct: At Mount Hor, near the border of Edom, the LORD said to Moses and Aaron,

verses.kjv: Aaron shall be gathered unto his people: for he shall not enter into the land which I have given unto the children of Israel, because ye rebelled against my word at the water of Meribah.
verses.web: “Aaron shall be gathered to his people; for he shall not enter into the land which I have given to the children of Israel, because you rebelled against my word at the waters of Meribah.
verses.ct: "Aaron is about to die. He will not enter the land I have given to the Israelites, because both of you defied my command at the waters of Meribah.

verses.kjv: Take Aaron and Eleazar his son, and bring them up unto mount Hor:
verses.web: Take Aaron and Eleazar his son, and bring them up to Mount Hor;
verses.ct: Take Aaron and his son Eleazar and bring them up Mount Hor.

verses.kjv: And strip Aaron of his garments, and put them upon Eleazar his son: and Aaron shall be gathered unto his people, and shall die there.
verses.web: and strip Aaron of his garments, and put them on Eleazar his son. Aaron shall be gathered, and shall die there.”
verses.ct: Remove Aaron's priestly garments and put them on his son Eleazar. Aaron will die there on the mountain."

verses.kjv: And Moses did as the LORD commanded: and they went up into mount Hor in the sight of all the congregation.
verses.web: Moses did as LORD commanded. They went up onto Mount Hor in the sight of all the congregation.
verses.ct: Moses did exactly what the LORD commanded. The three of them climbed Mount Hor while the entire community watched.

verses.kjv: And Moses stripped Aaron of his garments, and put them upon Eleazar his son; and Aaron died there in the top of the mount: and Moses and Eleazar came down from the mount.
verses.web: Moses stripped Aaron of his garments, and put them on Eleazar his son. Aaron died there on the top of the mountain, and Moses and Eleazar came down from the mountain.
verses.ct: Moses removed Aaron's priestly garments and placed them on Eleazar. Then Aaron died there on the top of the mountain. Moses and Eleazar came back down.

verses.kjv: And when all the congregation saw that Aaron was dead, they mourned for Aaron thirty days, even all the house of Israel.
verses.web: When all the congregation saw that Aaron was dead, they wept for Aaron thirty days, even all the house of Israel.
verses.ct: When the whole community realized that Aaron was dead, the entire house of Israel mourned for him for 30 days.
